description: The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) has a requirement to acquire two (2) Snowmobiles that meet all regulatory requirements and have a complete set of manuals. Snowmobiles must be delivered to the DFO head office.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
## Project Details

* **Procurement Reference #:** WS3816576390-Doc3816576441
* **Project Title (English):** F4642-220486 - Snowmobile
* **Project Title (French):** F4642-220486 - Motoneige

## Key Dates

* **Publication Date:** January 18, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** February 3, 2023, 14:00 EST
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** March 31, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date:** None

## Project Overview

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) invites proposals for the Supply and Delivery of two (2) snowmobiles. The successful supplier will provide the equipment in accordance with the specifications outlined in the tender documents.

## Notice Type

* **Notice Type (English):** Request for Proposal
* **Notice Type (French):** Demande de propositions

## Procurement Details

* **Procurement Category:** Goods and Services (GD)
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open bidding
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price

## Relevant Trade Agreements

This procurement is covered under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

## Contact Information

For any inquiries related to this tender, please contact:

* **Danny Arseneau, Contract Authority**
* Email: [danny.arseneau@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:danny.arseneau@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* Phone: Not provided

## Additional Information

Please note the MODIFICATION OF CLOSING TIME: As per the updated instructions, all required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted by February 3, 2023, at 14:00 EST. Any submissions received after this date and time will be declared non-compliant. To access the bid documents, please visit the following URL: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/15163919?extsite=MTUxNjM5MTlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==. [1]

Please be sure to manually fill in the [1] to the applicable instructions based on the source material. It is also a good idea to double-check the text to see if the only field that was not filled was not relevant to the rewritten text. 

```INSERT Actual data at the Right place of Rewritten Text```
